upcoming.title: Sewa Diwali 2023
upcoming.description:
Humane Sleep Project is driven by an unwavering sense of duty to expand our outreach. San Jose and Oakland serve as symbolic representations of our commitment to addressing the multi-faceted dimensions of the homelessness crisis. Our mission transcends the mere distribution of sleeping supplies; it encompasses the recognition of the humanity of each individual and the provision of a lasting sense of security as we consistently visit the same encampments.

To tackle this critical issue, the Humane Sleep Project collaborated with Sewa Diwali and the Kannada Koota of Northern California (KKNC) to secure essential items for distribution. Generously donated by KKNC, the organization received fleece blankets, thermal socks, gloves, and beanies to assemble comprehensive winter warmth kits. Trader Joe's further supported our efforts by providing paper bags for packing the items and has committed to ongoing support through donations of food and additional sleeping supplies.

Over two street outreach days, nearly 100 kits were assembled and distributed, serving as a meaningful contribution to creating a safer winter for California's homeless population. This hands-on approach allowed our organization to witness firsthand the challenging realities faced by unsheltered individuals and the profound impact that even modest acts of kindness can have on their lives.

past.title: Livermore Rotary Outreach
past.description:
From July to December 2024, the Humane Sleep Project launched a major outreach initiative in Livermore, made possible through a generous $3,500 grant from the Livermore Rotary Club. With these funds, we were able to purchase and distribute 100 sleeping bags, 120 hygiene kits, and 120 blankets to members of the local homeless community. Each kit was thoughtfully assembled with essential items to help individuals meet basic needs and endure the challenges of living without shelter, especially as colder months approached.

This effort was strengthened by the collaboration and support of several local nonprofits and organizations. Groups such as Cornerstone Church and Shepherdâ€™s Gate partnered with us in distributing the supplies across various parts of Livermore. Their involvement not only expanded our reach but also deepened the collective impact of our mission. Together, we created a network of support that allowed more individuals to be served with care, efficiency, and dignity.

The Livermore outreach stands as a testament to the power of community partnerships and the tangible difference that targeted funding can make. Through the coordinated efforts of nonprofits, local supporters, and our dedicated team, we were able to bring warmth, hygiene, and hope to over a hundred individuals in need. The Humane Sleep Project remains committed to continuing this momentum and advocating for compassionate responses to homelessness across California.
